blog.name: marablooms
blog.title: MaraBlooms
blog.description: Hi, I'm Mara! I'm a 26-year-old dork from Nashville. Here is where I share pics from my adventures. I cosplay, draw, sing, act, game, read fanfiction, and teach. I also run the very silly blog Fire Nation and Recreation | ATLA, LoK, HP, SW, GoT, Westworld, Guardians of the Galaxy, BBC Sherlock, Zelda, Parks & Rec, The Office, Stranger Things, Disney, Pokémon, Downton Abbey, Man in the High Castle, Hunger Games

summary: Valerie and Tatiana head into the Game of Thrones portion of events with Bryan and Lisa from Geek Pop. A whole hour is spent on...
caption:
Valerie and Tatiana head into the Game of Thrones portion of events with Bryan and Lisa from Geek Pop. A whole hour is spent on “The Long Night,” starting with everyone’s totally incorrect predictions for the episode (0:55). Then comes the actual review of the episode and the Game of Thrones season thus far (24:10), predictions for the rest of the series (35:00), and even some miscellaneous comparisons and hopes for the books (1:02:00).

You can let us know your thoughts in the comments below, or on our Podomatic page here.

summary: sansa wasn’t talking shit about daenerys, she told tyrion that he is loyal to dany and she is not, which is why they would never...
body: sansa wasn’t talking shit about daenerys, she told tyrion that he is loyal to dany and she is not, which is why they would never work out. but yall just love to victimize dany and demonize sansa huh.

blog.title: Kylo Ren’s Sidepiece
blog.description: Ash. Unapologetic Black Girl. Multi-fandom. Don't come for me or my favs unless I send for you.

summary: 1/Do you think the final 3 episodes will top this one? What do you think of what Sansa said to Tyrion and why did she say it and...
question: 1/Do you think the final 3 episodes will top this one? What do you think of what Sansa said to Tyrion and why did she say it and what do you think Messindeis reaction? I hate it cause it's like you're the best for not raping me and tutoring me like Ramsay did when I was your familys captive and your child bride. Sansa's getting so much hate for that scene and I'm not sure why they added it in the first place, what are we getting from this conversation?But the entire crypts scenes were a mess imo
answer:
2/ I’ve seen someone on twitter say she needs redemption arc💀💀💀💀 cause she hasn’t done anything good in their eyes and the whole knights of the vale thing and “undermining Jon” and hating Dany. Someone even mocked her for being raped and the wording of his mockery is so disgusting, I swear I’m not making this up. Like, this makes me wonder what does the writer want for her? Nothing is being perceived well about her


first, thank you so much for wanting my opinion on this! :)

I think the final three episodes might not top episode 3 in spectacle department but I think the final 3 episodes will have more compelling drama than the first 3 combined. Things are about to get really messy and it’s gonna happen fast. i’m really excited about it. 

As far as Sansa’s words to Tyrion. I think that there are two parts to her behavior. I think a part of her wanted to connect with the only person she had any sort of decent history with at that moment. she was terrified and without her family. She clearly wanted to be out there with her people and at her sister’s side but she knew it wasn’t safe so she was stuck in the dark with a bunch of people she’s not that close to with the fear that she could die at any minute of the WWs breech the entry to the crypts. Tyrion was the only person down there she had any real connection to so it was natural for her to want to connect with him. Despite their marriage being arranged and what his family did to her family Sansa see’s Tyrion as someone who was decent to her at a time when no one else was. I know book Tyrion was different but in show canon from Sansa’s POV Tyrion never tried to force himself on her, he tried to comfort her when her family was murdered, and he tried to protect her from joffrey as best as he could so I think she will always have a certain fondness from him for the simple fact that he was decent at a time when she was starved of common decency from everyone else. I think sharing that moment with Tyrion helped Sansa feel less alone down there and was a good distraction. 

I also think that Sansa has recognized that Tyrion as a clear soft spot for her. He sought her out soon after he got to Winterfell. He looks at her with a certain mix of longing and admiration. He keeps mentioning how they were married and alluding to wishing they still were. So I think that even though the first part of her communication with him was about making a genuine connection with someone familiar in a terrifying situation, the second part of her conversation to him was about her planting seeds for the future if there is one. Sansa knows that Tyrion and Dany’s relationship is hot and cold and Tyrion is insecure about his position with her. She also knows that Dany has doubts about him despite her recent outward show of confidence in him. I think she also knows exactly what is driving Tyrion and she’s already mentioned that men do stupid things for “love”. Tyrion’s rocky relationship with the woman that Sansa clearly opposes and his clear soft spot for her means that Sansa is a clear avenue to manipulate a valuable player of the game for her own cause. I don’t for a second think she would ever give Tyrion a chance but she wanted a light moment with him and she wanted Tyrion to think that he has a chance if he shifts his loyalties to her later down the line. Getting Dany’s had to betray her and join her cause , as well as securing the loyalty of one of the better thinkers in the realm would be HUGE in Sansa’s quest to get the north from under Dany and Sansa knows this so she’s slowly setting that play in motion and honestly I think that it just might work because Tyrion won’t be forgetting what they shared in those crypts on the brink of death anytime soon. Sansa knows that she can’t beat dany on manpower alone, Dany has 2 dragons, if she’s gonna dethrone her she’s gonna have to be smart, meticulous, and subtle in her approach and this is more of her doing that. 

as far as the idea that Sansa needs redemption goes, I’m sure that’s from someone who never liked Sansa to begin with. In order for someone to need redemption they have to commit egregious sins, and contrary to what the fanboys and Dany ass kickers think being born a traditionally feminine woman in a male dominated world is not a sin that requires redemption. The writers have slowly made Sansa one of the major players in the game and have slowly built up her leadership and loyalty from the people around her while showing the exact opposite of her rivals. They have also showed more than once that Sansa is usually always right. She was right about Jon’s trip to Dragonstone, she was right about Ramsey in the BOTB, she was right about Cersei, she was right about Jon letting the Karstarks and the Umbers off easy only showed other houses that they can also be disloyal and escape punishment which is why Lord Glover abandoned Jon and the war AGAIN. She also predicted exactly how the northern lords would react to Jon’s extended absence. Certain people choose to ignore this because they refuse to acknowledge that Sansa is a real threat to their favorite even tho it’s been established over and over at this point. Sansa is Dany’s rival right now even thought Dany only sees her as a minor nuisance on her quest to the bigger problem in Cersei but I suspect she will learn soon enough that she should have paid more attention to the threat Sansa posed to her because Sansa will snatch everything she holds dear right from under her without every having to lift a finger or swords. 

Basically the writer’s plan for Sansa is LEADERSHIP. She’s clearly being positioned as a contender for a crown and as a rival for Dany. At this point the only question left is which crown that is, the northern crown or the crown of the 7 kindgoms. The sansa haters know this and that’s why they made, it’s not that they aren’t picking up on it, they are, they just refuse to acknowledge it and think that nitpicking her every move and bringing up old stuff will someone make that reality go away.

Nothing is being perceived well about her

blog.name: lady-griffin
blog.title: LadyGriffin's Home
blog.description: A bad idea written down is far better and far more useful to you than a blank sheet of paper and a mythical piece of brilliance that has been stuck in your head out of fear of failure. Go ahead and fail. Then make it better.

summary: O! for a muse of fire, that would ascend the brightest heaven of invention.                                                    ...
caption:
O! for a muse of fire, that would ascend the brightest heaven of invention.

                                                                                        William Shakespeare

The different kinds of fire in Westeros personified by the different women of Westeros. 


My first ever gifs and gifset.

                                                                                        William Shakespeare

The different kinds of fire in Westeros personified by the different women of Westeros. 


My first ever gifs and gifset.

summary: The symbolism of Sansa Stark being the first Stark to loose her Direwolf, at the hands of a Lannister, because of something she...
body: The symbolism of Sansa Stark being the first Stark to loose her Direwolf, at the hands of a Lannister, because of something she didn’t do, is fucking heart wrenching. She was the first Stark to have her tether to her lineage ripped away, and she is also the Stark who takes back the North for her family. Sansa Stark is such a powerful character.

summary: Bastard Bros.
body:
Bastard Bros.

Gendry: I don’t know what you’re taking about.

Sansa: Yes, you do. You’ve been staring at her ever since you got here, and now you can’t take your eyes off of her.

Gendry: What? Jon you hearing this?

*Jon, sitting next to Sansa*: I don’t know what’s going on.

Gendry, feigning stupidity: Yeah, me niether.

Sansa, furious: You’ve been sitting here for this whole conversation. Gendry loves Arya.

Jon: Whaaaaat

Gendry: I don’t know what she’s talking about

Jon: ……

Jon: What were we talking about? I don’t know what’s going on.

*Jon covers the side of his face to wink at Gendry without Sansa knowing*

************************

*Jon and Gendry hunting out on the field*

J: You do know if you hurt her Drogon will, I repeat will, eat you.

G: I never would, but I’d rather that than face her.

*The two of them laugh*

summary:
So I just want to talk about the scene when Sansa and Tyrion are hidding in the crypt while the dead arrived.
Everybody is...
body:
Sansa and Tyrion in the crypt

So I just want to talk about the scene when Sansa and Tyrion are hidding in the crypt while the dead arrived.

Everybody is talking about the moment when Tyrion kiss Sansa’s hand (that was sooo sweet, my heart……) and there was many beautiful theories and texts about that !

But there is one thing I wanted to talk with you: they where already holding hands.

Sansa has her eyes shut and she stare at Tyrion after that. We have this beautiful moment when Tyrion and Sansa stare at each other and we can see that the Tyrion’s arm is reaching for something, and my point is that he had his hand on Sansa’s or they are even holding hands.

So Sansa wake up from this horrible true nightmare thanks to this gentle gesture. Like in the Joeffrey’s wedding when Tyrion try to give his support by touching is hand or when she knew that her family died.

It’s him, at this ultimate moment that make her realise that she’s not lonely anymore, he is here with her and again in the most tragic moment, when she don’t have any hopes.

I personnaly think that when she saw Tyrion in that posture, with such scared eyes like « I can’t say a word Because I’m scared » it’s the moment when she realise that she must do something to help him, that her turn to Help him and say when she take the dragonglass out « I’m scared too but we must be brave »

It’s the most powerfull scene of this episode for me. Two people who are not warriors but support each other by sweet gestures to give each other courage.

I hope there Will be a future for them Because I think they mean to be together, with a slowly reconnexion but a solid one !

I don’t think Tyrion talk about their wedding for no reasons. We can also add every stare and finally this oh my god beautiful hand kiss.

I don’t know what you think about that but I will gladly read your thoughts and theories about this scene ! :)

Ps: I’m not english so sorry for the maybe faults ! And the GIF come from the blog Agirlandabeast (go Check it’s a cool blog ! )

tags: d&d can't be that dumb to waste this opportunity can they?
summary: do you think we will have some scene pack starks? Who will reveal sansa and arya about R + L = J? I wanted a talk from Sansa and...
question: do you think we will have some scene pack starks? Who will reveal sansa and arya about R + L = J? I wanted a talk from Sansa and Sam, do we have? we dont have scenes between sam and sansa, it would be interesting to see that, would not it?
answer: Same. I think they’ll find out in ep 4 but D&D have written Sansa as Dany’s political rival and John said Sam seriously thinks Dany should not be queen. Logically they should be talking in ep 4 (earlier in fact) esp since Dany wants to focus on taking the Iron Throne. Jon is uninterested in the Iron Throne so it would make sense if Sansa and Sam do the work and push him towards it. Jon didn’t want to be king in season 6 but Sansa pushed for the retaking of Winterfell and she convinced Littlefinger to bring the Vale army and when Jon was crowned he accepted it. We might get a repeat of this soon. Either way if we’re getting a Starks vs Dany conflict, there’s no way Sam and Sansa don’t work together.

summary: How to Explain 'Game of Thrones' to Somebody Who Only Started Watching This Season
title: How to Explain 'Game of Thrones' to Somebody Who Only Started Watching This Season
body:
How to Explain ‘Game of Thrones’ to Somebody Who Only Started Watching This Season

It’s one of the most popular things on television, regardless of genre. It’s also one of the most difficult to explain to somebody who hasn’t been watching it from the beginning.

But who has time for that?

Here is famed steampunk fantasy author John R. White‘s breakdown of the series for the Seriously Uninitiated.

Everybody wants to be king, except for Ned.

A fat drunk king has a…

View On WordPress

blog.name: historialiferuinerreiss
blog.title: Bend The Knee, Bitches
blog.description: Stans every female character that gets hate

tags: it almost sucks worse than the snk fandom with its endless thirst for levi
summary:
All those Sansa hate memes are pretty unintelligent. 
What is the problem with Sansa saying she doesn’t know how to use a...
body:
All those Sansa hate memes are pretty unintelligent.

What is the problem with Sansa saying she doesn’t know how to use a dagger? She’s saying she has no combat training. She knows what stabbing is.

What is so bad about someone with no combat training taking shelter instead of going out to certainly get killed by zombies?

What’s wrong with her being afraid of Daenerys? She doesn’t know her! She just knows that her dad roasted two Starks to death. She’s gone through a lot of shit from people she had trusted.

She’s naive if she trusts someone but she’s a bitch if she doesn’t trust someone?

And the one from long ago saying ‘you were engaged to one psychopath and married another’ as if that was her choice at all is victim blaming and fucking hideous. This fandom is so gross!

summary: You all can and should make posts about badass Lyanna Mormont is, HOWEVER you all are fake as fuck if you're not also making...
body: You all can and should make posts about badass Lyanna Mormont is, HOWEVER you all are fake as fuck if you’re not also making them about Sansa. Primarily Lyanna is known for how she talked smack, and my girl Sansa has been subtly standing up to her abusers and letting them known she’s still got her spirit with WAY more at stake.

summary: “She turned that way, and saw only the city, streets and alleys and hills and bottoms and more streets and more alleys and the...
body:
“She turned that way, and saw only the city, streets and alleys and hills and bottoms and more streets and more alleys and the stone of distant walls, yet she knew that beyond them was open country, farms and fields and forests, and beyond that, north and north and north again, stood Winterfell.“

A Game of Thrones, Sansa VI
